title: The strategic patience of 'Greater Israel' ideologists
summary: These ideologists are betting on the long term to impose their colonial ideas. A minority of them advocate for a return to Gaza.

title: Does the government want Parisians to leave during the 2024 Olympic Games?
summary: The French Minister of Transport has called on Parisians to 'take time off' during the Games. In other words, if they don't commute, it will make it easier for the city to accommodate the 800,000 spectators expected every day.

title: Mahsa Amini's family prevented from leaving Iran to collect Sakharov Prize
summary: According to the family's lawyer, the Aminis were banned from boarding a plane to France despite having a valid visa and their passports have been confiscated.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'For the moment, Netanyahu strongly rejects the two-state solution'
summary: The Israeli Prime Minister is not in the best of positions to oppose the American vision of 'a revitalized Palestinian Authority,' observes 'Le Monde' columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Backstage at the Paris Opera's 'Nutcracker' ballet
summary: The dancers of the Opéra de Paris rehearse the ballet from the version imagined by Rudolf Nureyev, showing at the Opéra Bastille from December 8 to January 1.

title: Dispute brews over auction of Asterix and Cleopatra cover
summary: Sylvie Uderzo, Albert Uderzo's daughter and beneficiary, disputes the provenance of the work, estimated at between €400,000 and €500,000, and described as a 'gift' to one of her father's friends.

title: US State Department bypasses Congress and approves sale of ammunition to Israel
summary: The Biden administration on Saturday OKed the sale of nearly 14,000 rounds of tank ammunition to Israel. The emergency provision invoked is rare, but not unprecedented.

title: France detains 80 in largest child sex crime swoop
summary: The men arrested come from a wide range of backgrounds, they include a local councilor and two schoolteachers.

title: Guyana: Lula warns Maduro against 'unilateral measures'
summary: Tensions over the Essequibo oil-rich region have soared since Macuro's government held a referendum in which 95% of voters supported declaring Venezuela the region's rightful owner.

title: COP28 climate talks heat up after OPEC moves to block mention of fossil fuel phase-out
summary: OPEC Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais sent a letter to the group's 13 members and 10 Russian-led allies this week after negotiators at climate talks in Dubai released a draft deal that included calls for a phase-out of fossil fuels.

title: Sweden's 'internet priest' Charlotte Frycklund accused of betraying the Bible
summary: Frycklund, a theology buff, runs the official social media accounts of the Church of Sweden, an Evangelical Lutheran church that was formerly the state church. Her regular messages of support for transgender people have provoked diverse reactions.

title: 'Julstress': Swedish parents' Christmas preparation anxiety
summary: In Sweden, some people prepare weeks in advance to make sure they're ready when the festivities kick off in early December.

title: Complex trial ends with conviction of six teenagers over 2020 beheading of French teacher
summary: A second trial is scheduled to take place in 2024, this time before the Paris special criminal court.

title: 3D-printed guns, a new untraceable and cheap arsenal
summary: A report by the Flemish Peace Institute and the Small Arms Survey, published on December 7, warns of the emerging risk of 'homemade' weapons.

title: Joe Biden tackles 'junk fees,' the hidden charges plaguing American consumers
summary: The US President is pushing for transparent pricing and protection against these fees, which are found everywhere from airlines to hotels and taxis.

title: Stakes are high for Ukraine as EU leaders divided ahead of December summit
summary: On December 14 and 15, the 27 member states are due to vote on the opening of accession negotiations with Kyiv and on financial and military aid to the war-torn country. For the time being, however, no compromise position is emerging.

title: Putin runs for re-election as protector of Russia against the West
summary: The 71-year-old Russian president declared his candidacy on Friday for the presidential election to be held on March 17, 2024.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Isolated United States rejects UN's call for 'immediate ceasefire'
summary: With their veto in the Security Council, the Americans have buried the fifth resolution since the start of the war.

title: Covid-19 epidemic returns in France as Christmas approaches
summary: The rise in infections coincides with the very rapid spread of the JN.1 variant, although the new strain does not appear more likely to cause severe forms of the disease.

title: UPenn president resigns after anti-Semitism testimony backlash
summary: Elizabeth Magill 'voluntarily tendered her resignation' after scathing criticism against her and other university leaders.

title: Egypt's upcoming election is tailor-made for Marshal Al-Sissi
summary: The incumbent president is expected to continue his reign for a third six-year term following the December 12 vote. The only unknown factor is turnout, with Egyptians making no secret of their disinterest in the vote.

title: Guyanese and Venezuelan leaders to meet Thursday on border row
summary: Venezuela has launched maneuvers to take over a part of Guyana after a controversial referendum was held last week.

title: The United Arab Emirates' takeover of African forests
summary: As the oil-rich country hosts COP28, an Emirati company has signed agreements in Liberia, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe to convert part of their land into carbon credits – acts of 'greenwashing' and 'colonialism,' some NGOs say.

title: Nobel winner Mohammadi to go on new hunger strike as peace prize is awarded
summary: Her husband says the strike is in solidarity with the Baha'i religious minority, which is the target of discrimination in Iran.

title: China and Philippines trade blame for collision in disputed waters
summary: Both vessels suffered damage in the incident, which took place in the South China Sea.

title: 14 killed in central Mexico in clash between criminal gang and villagers
summary: Authorities say 10 of the dead are gang members. The violent Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dominant in the area for many years.

title: Geert Wilders and his disruptive haircut won the Dutch election. Does anyone care?
summary: The far-right scored a surprise victory in the Dutch parliamentary elections on November 22. A perfect opportunity to get to know its triumphant leader, Geert Wilders, once again.

title: Paris 2024: IOC allowed Russians to take part in the Olympics. What happens now?
summary: How many Russian and Belarussian athletes will take part in the Olympics and how will their neutrality be ensured? While the IOC's decision comes as no surprise, it creates a series of questions.

title: From Mexico's Sinaloa to the skyscrapers of Dubai, the art of laundering fentanyl money
summary: Bertrand Monnet, a business professor and a specialist in crime economics, conducted a field study into the trafficking of this devastating opioid. He explains how the Mexican Sinaloa cartel launders its enormous profits in the emirate.

title: Zelensky, Bolsonaro to attend Javier Milei's inauguration ceremony in Argentina
summary: After taking the oath of office, Milei will give his first speech as president and swear in a cabinet of nine ministers.

title: COP28 pledges meet only 30% of needed energy emission cuts, says IEA
summary: 'While the pledges are positive steps forward in tackling the energy sector's greenhouse gas emissions, they would not be nearly enough to move the world onto a path to reaching international climate targets,' the IEA said in its report.

title: COP28: Fossil fuel taxation at the heart of the battle to finance climate transition
summary: In preparation for COP30 in 2025, an international taskforce launched in June is to work on ways of getting the biggest greenhouse gas emitters to contribute.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Anti-poor ideology ultimately leads to a general deterioration in the quality of public service'
summary: Taking it out on the poorest will not solve social problems, argues the economist in his column, after a Le Monde investigation into the algorithm used by France's welfare agency to decide which households to audit for benefit fraud.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #8 Tapas in Zaragoza
summary: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 8: Zaragoza.

title: Hong Kong holds first council elections under drastic new rules that shut out pro-democracy candidates
summary: Residents went to the polls on Sunday in the first district council elections since an electoral overhaul was implemented under Beijing's guidance of 'patriots' administering the city.

title: The trauma of Israeli Arab women freed in exchanges with Hamas
summary: 15 women, arrested after the October 7 attacks for expressing themselves on social media, have been exchanged for hostages held by Hamas, without having asked to be. This association with the Islamist movement could harm them in Israel.

title: Netflix's black Hannibal sparks controversy in Tunisia
summary: The choice of African-American actor Denzel Washington to portray the famous Carthaginian general has set social media abuzz, and is now being debated in Parliament.

title: Why is Ukraine's counteroffensive failing?
summary: In an interview with The Economist, Valeriy Zaluzhny, the commander-in-chief of Ukraine's army, claims that his country has reached a 'stalemate.'

title: Javier Milei warns economy will 'worsen' but vows 'new era' in Argentina
summary: On Sunday morning, Milei was sworn in inside the National Congress building, and outgoing President Alberto Fernández placed the presidential sash upon him.

title: Besieged once again, Gaza's health system is in agony
summary: Once again bombarded since the end of the truce on December 1, hospitals are unable to accommodate the thousands of Gazans in need of emergency care.

title: Mohamed Bazoum, the unyielding captive of Niger's junta
summary: The head of state, overthrown by a putsch in July, refuses to resign. He has been detained in Niamey for over four months, along with his wife and their son.

title: The best Yule logs of 2023 to test across France
summary: From classic chocolate and hazelnuts to exotic mango and lime, kirsch or speculoos, these 15 desserts provide a variety of tastes (and colors) to satisfy your cravings!
